greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n, k) (0<=k<=2n) is the number of Delannoy paths of length n, having k steps.
comment: A Delannoy path of length n is a path from (0, 0) to (n, n), consisting of steps E = (1,0), N = (0,1) and D = (1,1)).
Row n has 2*n+1 terms, the first n of which are 0.
Row sums are the central Delannoy numbers (A001850).
Column sums are the central trinomial coefficients (A002426).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
Robert A. Sulanke, Objects Counted by the Central Delannoy Numbers, Journal of Integer Sequences, Volume 6, 2003, Article 03.1.5.
formula: T(n, k) = A063007(n, k-n). - _Michael Somos_, Sep 22 2013
example: T(2, 3) = 6 because we have DNE, DEN, NED, END, NDE and EDN.
maple: for n from 0 to 8 do seq(T(n,k),k=0..2*n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
yser := series(gf, y, 12): ycoeff := n -> coeff(yser, y, n):
row := n -> seq(coeff(expand(ycoeff(n)), x, k), k=0..2*n):
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = binomial(n, k-n) * binomial(k, n)} /* _Michael Somos_, Sep 22 2013 */
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Jul 07 2005
